chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.execSummary:
The defendant Lois Anne Crowe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 347.413(1).
  • Hit and Run, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Def is to contact Ashland Co Jail to make arrangements to provide a DNA specimen w/in 7 days.

Meany appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 19CT78,20CT3,21CF130,22CF6,22CF18-- Agreement as in Option in offer to settle, 21CF130-- agreement states count 8, no count 8 on the case, State comments- count 5 is what she would plead to. Atty agrees that Count 5 is what she will plead to in the case. State comments, compl or info was not amended, count 5 is the same guideline penalties, atty agrees. Back on the record 3:27pm-- State filed an amended info, State complied with Vic rights. Parties Stipulate to RHT in the amount of $500. Def understands potential penalties. Off the record (3:35pm) Back on the record (3:39pm) Count 5 in 22CF6 mandatory mium fine $ that the Ct will need to order.  Def has no objection to the fine. PLEADS NC,  signed PLQ and DEJ, understands elements. admits to prior offenses, waives reading of info, Ct accepts pleas, factual basis in the compl, finds the def G in 22CF18-Cts 1,3 and 4, 22CF6 Cts 3,4 and 5, 21CF130 Cts 2,3 and 5, 19CT78 Ct 1, 20CT3 Ct 1. All other counts in those cases are DRI. State comments on sentencing. Atty comments on sentencing.

Covers cases New Charges, 21CF130, 20CT03, 19CT78 and 22CF06. Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there.
